devdoc.details: Holds the explicit consent given to a collector to get personal data from a user  ISSUE: transaction function can't return a value even if declared in the definition https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/questions/40730/why-is-web3j-java-not-generating-correct-return-types-for-my-contract

constructor.details: Create a new consent contract between a Data Subject and a Controller.

params._defaultPurposes: for which DS must do not give his explicit consent to process his PD
params._recipients: list of the recipients that will hold the personal data of the Subject
params.duration: validity expiration time of the contract (in seconds)

getAllProcessors().details: Returns all processors that has requested to process DS's personal data.

getData().details: Returns which data fields can be collected

getProcessingConsentSC(address).details: Returns the ProcessingConsent SC address of the specified processor, created from this contract.

grantConsent().details: Consent contract enabled by the Data Subject and/or Data Controller.

newPurpose(address,uint256,uint256,uint2.details: Create a new processing purpose for processor using dataSubject data and supervised by controller.

params.duration: validity expiration time of the contract (in seconds)

revokeConsent().details: Consent contract revoked by the Data Subject and/or Data Controller.

revokeConsentProcessor(address).details: Revoke consent for all ProcessingConsent SC for a specific processor.

revokeConsentPurpose(uint256).details: Revoke consent for all ProcessingConsent SC for a specific processing purpose.

verify().details: Returns the current state of this consent contract
